meanings.definition: Having a color similar to that of a clear sky or deep sea.
meanings.sent1: The sky looked bluer after the rain.
meanings.sent2: The ocean water appeared bluer as we sailed further away.
meanings.sent3: The sad clown's bluer makeup made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were bluer than the deepest ocean.
meanings.sent5: The bluer flowers in the garden stood out against the green leaves.

meanings.definition: To make or become sad or depressed.
meanings.sent1: The gloomy weather bluered his mood.
meanings.sent2: She bluered when she heard the bad news.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's sad eyes bluered everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The movie's ending really bluered me.
meanings.sent5: The lonely song bluered the atmosphere of the room.

meanings.definition: To make or become more intense or vivid.
meanings.sent1: The artist bluered the colors in his painting.
meanings.sent2: The sunset bluered as the evening progressed.
meanings.sent3: The spicy food bluered the flavors in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: His words bluered the impact of the speech.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds bluered the sky with their dark presence.
